definitions.text: the property of having material worth (often indicated by the amount of money something would bring if sold)
examples: the fluctuating monetary value of gold and silver
he puts a high price on his services
he couldn't calculate the cost of the collection

definitions.text: the amount of money needed to purchase something
examples: he got his new car on excellent terms

definitions.text: value measured by what must be given or done or undergone to obtain something
examples: the cost in human life was enormous
the price of success is hard work

definitions.text: the high value or worth of something
examples: her price is far above rubies

definitions.text: a monetary reward for helping to catch a criminal
examples: the cattle thief has a price on his head
they say that every politician has a price
The grocer priced his wares high

definitions.text: ascertain or learn the price of
examples: Have you priced personal computers lately?
